answers.answer: Ask him. I never asked my doc it always slipped my mind  and everyone swore he was going to be huge but he was 7lbs 7oz

My doctor never really talked about this.  I was always told my babies would be average size.  They just do a belly measurement that is a estimated guess.  Or they do a projection from your ultrasound measurements.  But mine never really did this either.  Over 8 pounds for both.  Felt like 50.  :>)

You mean you had preeclampsia with your first baby?  I do know that this does not correlate to high blood pressure with subsequent pregnancies.  I had pregnancy induced hypertension with baby number one (never went to full preeclampsia, thank goodness) but my blood pressure was perfect for baby number two.  I'm sure they are on the look out with your urine and protein checks and blood pressure checks, right?
Most doctors don't predict because it isn't accurate.

I do want to say as I rolled into my 9th month, my doctor said she thought my baby might be big so scheduled an induction for 39 weeks.  I think really she was just trying to help me out as I had a one year old at home and she also wanted me to deliver when it was her on day for deliveries at the hospital.  So, I was induced at 39 weeks with baby number 2 with the official reason being a big baby.  That baby was 8 pounds (not really considered that big of a baby. )  So, you may be induced around 39 weeks or so.  good luck

@specialmom, They have been on the lookout for it . My doctor prescribed me some low aspirin. . . & at my last appointments I was fine . I have my next one on Friday, she did tell me that my son was growing fine . But, i'm not sure what in the heck that could mean. . . I would love more info about my son, this time I have questions to ask! Not that I think anything is wrong but I have became concerned about the fact that was never brought up. Maybe i'm just over exaggerating.

question: I'm A Little Upset Because I Haven't Been Told How Much My Baby Weighs . I Am 32 Weeks & Clueless About My Son . . . My Doc Is A Very Good Doctor . I Honestly Feel Like He's Going To Be A Big Baby, My Daughter Weighed 8.13Pounds & I Refuse To Push Out A Huge Child. . . I Also Suffered From Preeclampsia. Ugh! What Should I Do?
title: Upset A Bit . . .
